cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina and 450 miles S of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north, then north-northwest toward the North Carolina coast and the Mid-Atlantic states through Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central North Carolina coast (between Cape Fear and Cape Lookout)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Surf City NC to Chincoteague VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point and Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from South Carolina through Delaware
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible with gusts below tropical-storm strength; 34-kt wind chance only 4%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rise possible (<1 ft) due to long-period swells and higher tides
weather_observation.rainfall: Intermittent showers, generally less than 2 inches total
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents affecting coastal approaches and pilot boarding areas
